title: Google\Cloud\OsConfig\V1\PatchDeployment
name: PatchDeployment
description:
Patch deployments are configurations that individual patch jobs use to complete a patch. These configurations include instance filter, package repository settings, and a schedule. For more information about creating and managing patch deployments, see Scheduling patch jobs.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.osconfig.v1.PatchDeployment

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.name
params.description: Unique name for the patch deployment resource in a project. The patch deployment name is in the form: projects/{project_id}/patchDeployments/{patch_deployment_id}. This field is ignored when you create a new patch deployment.

params.name: data.description
params.description: Optional. Description of the patch deployment. Length of the description is limited to 1024 characters.

params.name: data.instance_filter
params.description: Required. VM instances to patch.

params.name: data.patch_config
params.description: Optional. Patch configuration that is applied.

params.name: data.duration
params.description: Optional. Duration of the patch. After the duration ends, the patch times out.

params.name: data.one_time_schedule
params.description: Required. Schedule a one-time execution.

params.name: data.recurring_schedule
params.description: Required. Schedule recurring executions.

params.name: data.create_time
params.description: Output only. Time the patch deployment was created. Timestamp is in RFC3339 text format.

params.name: data.update_time
params.description: Output only. Time the patch deployment was last updated. Timestamp is in RFC3339 text format.

params.name: data.last_execute_time
params.description: Output only. The last time a patch job was started by this deployment. Timestamp is in RFC3339 text format.

This field is ignored when you create a new patch deployment.
